 1 <?php namespace CupOfTea\TwoStream\Console;
 2 
 3 use Illuminate\Console\Command as ConsoleCommand;
 4 
 5 use Symfony\Component\Console\Input\ArrayInput;
 6 
 7 abstract class Command extends ConsoleCommand
 8 {
 9     
10     /**
11      * {@inheritdoc}
12      */
13     public function call($command, array $arguments = array(), $level = 0)
14     {
15         $instance = $this->getApplication()->find($command);
16         $arguments['command'] = $command;
17         $result = $instance->run(new ArrayInput($arguments), $this->out->level($level));
18         
19         return $result;
20     }
21     
22     /**
23      * Write a string as information output.
24      *
25      * @param   string   $string
26      * @param   int      $level
27      * @return void
28      */
29     public function info($string, $level = 0)
30     {
31         $this->out->level($level)->writeln("<info>$string</info>");
32     }
33     
34     /**
35      * Write a string as standard output.
36      *
37      * @param   string   $string
38      * @param   int      $level
39      * @return void
40      */
41     public function line($string, $level = 0)
42     {
43         
44         $this->out->level($level)->writeln($string);
45     }
46     
47     /**
48      * Write a string as comment output.
49      *
50      * @param   string   $string
51      * @param   int      $level
52      * @return void
53      */
54     public function comment($string, $level = 0)
55     {
56         $this->out->level($level)->writeln("<comment>$string</comment>");
57     }
58     
59     /**
60      * Write a string as question output.
61      *
62      * @param   string   $string
63      * @param   int      $level
64      * @return void
65      */
66     public function question($string, $level = 0)
67     {
68         $this->out->level($level)->writeln("<question>$string</question>");
69     }
70     
71     /**
72      * Write a string as error output.
73      *
74      * @param   string   $string
75      * @param   int      $level
76      * @return void
77      */
78     public function error($string, $level = 0)
79     {
80         $this->out->level($level)->writeln("<error>$string</error>");
81     }
